personalInfo.name: Jules Gueguen
personalInfo.title: Creative Technologist Student
personalInfo.bio: I am a Master’s student in Creative Technology at the IFT, pursuing a dual 'Engineer-Manager' degree at ESILV and EMLV. I am passionate about sustainable innovation and leveraging technology to enhance sports and health.

projects.title: The First Recyclable Kiteboard
projects.description: 'Forever' is the first fully recyclable kiteboard. The goal was to design a board that respects the environment while maintaining optimal performance. We used eco-responsible materials and developed a manufacturing process incorporating a new resin technology that can be dissolved at the end of its life, allowing the different materials to be separated and recycled under specific conditions. This new manufacturing method paves the way for a more eco-conscious practice of kitesurfing as well as other board sports (skateboarding, wakeboarding, surfing, etc.)

projects.title: K'e-mono: The Smart Kimono for Judo
projects.description: Equipped with embedded pressure and motion sensors, this smart kimono provides insights into key aspects of judo techniques, such as grip, posture, and force distribution. This data-driven approach helps judokas and their coaches enhance performance and refine techniques. K’e-mono also integrates modular components, extending the product's lifespan and reducing its environmental impact.

projects.title: Kickstarter Campaign
projects.description: Koloburo is an innovative cable organizer made from recycled leather, designed to keep your chargers within reach and spare you the hassle of searching for them. By sticking it to your desk or bedside table, you can insert up to five chargers and enjoy easy access to your cables. Koloburo combines style and practicality while supporting eco-friendly practices and local manufacturing. We spent six months developing prototypes and preparing the funding campaign and its communication, ultimately achieving 678% funding compared to the initial goal.

projects.title: Neurosense Sports Helmet
projects.description: The Neurosense Sports Helmet is a smart helmet designed to detect and alert in the event of violent impacts in contact sports. Equipped with an integrated pressure sensor, it measures the force of shocks and sends an audible signal when the danger threshold is exceeded, allowing for quick intervention to protect the health of athletes. This system could also assist healthcare professionals by providing accurate data on impacts.

projects.title: Recycled Interactive Lamp
projects.description: During the first week of my Master's program in 'Creative Technology', we undertook an express project aiming to create an innovative interactive lamp using various manufacturing techniques. Over the course of five days, we designed a lamp from an old book that activates the light upon opening and closing. The electronic system features three LEDs—red, green, and blue—each controllable with a dimmer switch, allowing users to create their own custom color shades.

workExperience.role: Project Manager Intern in Continuous Improvement
keyResponsibilities: Deployment of the 'fabriq' software to digitize and standardize industrial processes:
Created the project deployment plan (budget, risks, change management)
Configured and populated the software, KPI and dashboard creation
Trained 80 employees (workers and managers) and provided daily support
